qd-configuration:
This is a required parameter that tells QuillDriver what the root element of its data files must be. For example, in this case, it must be 'WORDLIST'.
This is a required parameter that tells QuillDriver where to find the audio or video file associated with this XML annotation. Its value is an XPATH expression which is based at the root of the XML tree.
Without this parameter, QuillDriver will not know how to find out which nodes are 'associated' with time codes and which are not. The value of this parameter is an XPATH expression which returns all XML nodes that are associated with time codes, again searching from the root of the XML tree.
The parameter qd.timealignednodes returns the set of XML nodes associated with time codes. Once this set is established, then we still need to know how get the start and end time for an associated node. This parameter is an XPATH expression which locates the start time for a XML node associated with time codes.
The parameter qd.timealignednodes returns the set of XML nodes associated with time codes. Once this set is established, then we still need to know how get the start and end time for an associated node. This parameter is an XPATH expression which locates the end time for a XML node associated with time codes.
For any given node, this required parameter locates the nearest 'playable' parent node. When you click on a node in the annotation the default action is to play the nearest playable parent node. For example, if time codes are associated with Sentences and you click on a Word, then setting this parameter correctly ensures that its containing sentence is played.
If the media is stopped, this plays it; and if the media is playing, this pauses it.
This plays the media, starting from X second(s) before the current media point.
This navigation is used to play the next part of the text that has time codes associated with it. First, the next playable node is located. Then, it is played because this viewing function is associated with the QuillDriver command 'playNode'.
This navigation is used to play the current part of the text that has time codes associated with it, for example, the current sentence. First, the current node is located. Then, it is played because this viewing function is associated with the QuillDriver command 'playNode'.
Play the last X second(s) of the current sentence.
This navigation is used to play the last part of the text that has time codes associated with it. First, the next playable node is located. Then, it is played because this viewing function is associated with the QuillDriver command 'playNode'.
Jumps to the start time of the current sentence, without playing it.
` Jumps to the end time of the current sentence, without playing it. -->
Jumps to the next sentence, without playing it.
Jumps to the previous sentence, without playing it.
Takes the currently open media file or URL and copies it into the transcript.
This assigns the start time of the current sentence to the start time in the time coding window.
This assigns the stop time of the current sentence to the stop time in the time coding window.
This editing function is used to copy the time codes found under the video next to the 'Start' and 'Stop' buttons into your XML file. They will be copied to the current node you are working on. For example, if you are typing or translating text, they will be assigned to the current 'S' (Sentence) node.
Removes time codes for current sentence.
Increases the start time of the current sentence by a specified value.
Increases the start time of the current sentence by a specified value.
Decreases the start time of the current sentence by a specified value.
Decreases the start time of the current sentence by a specified value.
Increases the stop time of the current sentence by a specified value.
Increases the stop time of the current sentence by a specified value.
Decreases the stop time of the current sentence by a specified value.
Decreases the stop time of the current sentence by a specified value.
This function inserts an empty word after the current word.
This function inserts an empty word before the current word.
This editing function deletes the word you are current working on.
Display WORDLIST tag but not its attributes.
Display TITLE tag but not its attributes.
This tells QuillDriver to display the TIB tag as 'TIB', and to display its contents, but to visually suppress its 'type' attribute.
This tells QuillDriver to display the ENG tag as 'ENG', and to display its contents, but to visually suppress its 'xml:lang' attribute.
